page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT 3
page.content: BARNTON AND LITTLE LEIGH 03600375 The workforce has been relatively stable - 25% of workers have been in the same job for 15-20 years with only 1 or 2 employers.20% have changed employers frequently but not jobs. There is evidence that mobility is increasing - 15% have started a new job within the last few months. 80% of our respondants claimed a high level of job satisfaction, 10% were fairly happy but would have preferred an alternative career and 10% were dissatisfied. Less than half those who were eligible for Trades Union member- ship had joined.Those who had, were split evenly into those who recognised the benefits of membership and those who worked in negotiated closed shops. Surprisingly none of our sample are at present unemployed but 40% have experienced being out of work.
